code: @Manual{,   title = {fluidsynth: Read and Play Digital Music (MIDI)},   author = {Jeroen Ooms},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 1.0.0},   url = {https://docs.ropensci.org/fluidsynth/ https://ropensci.r-universe.dev/fluidsynth}, }

title: Read and Play Digital Music (MIDI)
text: Bindings libfluidsynth play render midi files. See https://docs.ropensci.org/fluidsynth

title: Read and Play Digital Music (MIDI)
text: can install development version fluidsynth : Debian/Ubuntu need install libfluidsynth-dev first: Fedora need: RHEL/CentOS/RockyLinux first need enable EPEL:
code: install.packages("fluidsynth", repos = 'https://ropensci.r-universe.dev') sudo apt-get install libfluidsynth-dev sudo dnf install fluidsynth-dev yum install -y epel-release sudo yum install fluidsynth-dev

what: Play or convert a midi file — midi_play
title: Play or convert a midi file — midi_play
text: Play midi file audio device, render file, parse raw data. Additional settings can specified, see fluidsynth_setting_list available options.

title: Play or convert a midi file — midi_play
code: midi_play(   midi = demo_midi(),   soundfont = soundfont_path(),   audio.driver = NULL,   settings = list(),   verbose = interactive() )  midi_convert(   midi = demo_midi(),   soundfont = soundfont_path(),   output = "output.mp3",   settings = list(),   verbose = interactive() )  midi_read(midi = demo_midi(), verbose = FALSE)  demo_midi()

title: Play or convert a midi file — midi_play
text: midi path midi file soundfont path soundfont audio.driver audio driver use, see fluidsynth docs settings named vector additional settings fluidsynth_setting_list() verbose print progress status terminal output filename output.

title: Play or convert a midi file — midi_play
text: midi_read returns data frame midi events.

title: Play or convert a midi file — midi_play
text: midi_convert function internally uses fluidsynth generate raw wav file, av::av_audio_convert() convert requested format. See av::av_muxers() supported output formats corresponding file extension. need soundfont synthesize midi, see soundfonts page. Linux may also need specify audio.driver works hardware, although recent distributions defaults generally work.

title: Play or convert a midi file — midi_play
Fluidsynth settings — fluidsynth_settings
text: Get available settings types. See fluidsynth docs information available options.

title: Fluidsynth settings — fluidsynth_settings
text: setting string one options listed fluidsynth_setting_list(), see examples.

title: Managing soundfonts — soundfonts
text: FluidSynth requires soundfont synthesize midi. Linux distributions soundfonts often preinstalled, though quality varies. midi sounds poor, try using another soundfont.

title: Managing soundfonts — soundfonts
text: download automatically download soundfont none exists.

title: Managing soundfonts — soundfonts
text: path local soundfont synthesize midi file.

title: Managing soundfonts — soundfonts
text: GeneralUser-GS S. Christian Collins nice free soundfont. can use soundfont_download() install copy soundbank use package.
